items.sentence: I think there are a lot of good-looking women in Australia.
Tom can\'t get a drink in this club because he\'s underage.
Tom could have gone to the dance with Mary, but he didn\'t.
I definitely don\'t want to get married before I\'m thirty.
I didn\'t know Tom hadn\'t done what he was supposed to do.
I don\'t blame you for the accident. It wasn\'t your fault.
I suppose I should offer to pay Tom for what he did for us.
I suppose you have some ideas on how to handle this matter.
If something did happen to Tom, I don\'t know what I\'d do.
Some dog owners wonder if it\'s OK to feed their dogs fish.
Tom walked into the living room, still buttoning his shirt.
Mary borrowed her friend\'s dress, but forgot to return it.
Mary laid her head on Tom\'s shoulder and soon fell asleep.
Mary isn\'t really sick. She\'s just pretending to be sick.
I\'m not sure if I\'m going to be able to be there on time.
People came running out of the burning building, screaming.
Put all your eggs in one basket and then watch that basket.
I finally stopped trying to persuade Tom to clean his room.
I thought Tom had enough money to buy everything he needed.
Hundreds of soldiers ate in silence around their campfires.
